DOC.brief_title: Joint Attention Intervention Young Children With Autism
DOC.detailed_description: Young child autism experience severe deficit joint attention skill ( e.g . point object , show , follow another person 's gaze , respond invitation social interaction ) . Ability initiate respond joint attention link child 's late language ability . As mean improve language outcome child autism , important target joint attention early intervention program . This study investigate effectiveness joint attention intervention . Sixty 2-4 year old child autism randomize intervention group control group . Children group continue ordinary preschool program . However , child intervention group also participate 80 joint attention intervention session . The session ( 20 minute ) conduct twice day 8 week preschool teacher paraprofessional work preschool . Before start intervention preschool teacher paraprofessional teach teach joint attention skill initiate maintain episode joint engagement . During course intervention supervise trained counselor . Outcome measure include joint attention skill , language skill joint engagement . Children assess baseline , 10 week follow 6 month 1 year end intervention . The measure base direct test child , video observation questionnaires parent professional .
